subject: Re: [junit] Sun doesn't use JUnit. Why?
msgSnippet: ... Hash: SHA1 Hello javainsel, ... They don t use JUnit because they had to write their tests before Junit existed. On the other hand, the number of
messageBody:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Hello javainsel,

Am Samstag, 26. April 2003 10:46 schrieb javainsel:
> Today I downloaded "Java(TM) 2 SDK, Standard Edition (SCSL) 1.4.1"
> from Sun: http://wwws.sun.com/software/java2/download.html
>
> It includes the sources, tests and makefiles which are not included
> in the Java SDK 1.4.1.
>
> When I unpacked the archive which I've downloaded, I discovered that
> Sun doesn't use JUnit. They have custom test classes which are not
> automated like JUnit tests.
>
> Besides this they don't use Ant. They have some kind of makefiles
> instead.
>
> What do you think about it?

They don't use JUnit because they had to write their tests before Junit
existed. On the other hand, the number of regression bugs regularly showing
up in Java shows that there is some room for improvement in the way SUN are
doing their testing.

They don't use Ant for the JDK because they had to automize the JDK build long
before Ant existed.

If you take a lok at other APIs from SUN, you will see they actually do use
Ant, they just don't use it for the SDK SE yet.


Bye
- --
